layout.description: This notes the general layout. Officially, it's a Jekyll built-in. Use 'flexfolio' for more flexibility, or use 'photofolio' for a stricter (deprecated) layout. Options: flexfolio, photofolio
layout.x-intellij-html-description:
• This notes the general layout. Officially, it's a Jekyll built-in.
  • Use 'flexfolio' for more flexibility, or use 'photofolio' for a stricter (deprecated) layout.

Options: flexfolio, photofolio

title.description: Required. The name of the client. This is used in the browser title bar as well as the page title itself.
title.x-intellij-html-description:
Required. The name of the client.


Usage: Browser title bar, page title.

description.description: Required. A description of the client. This is usually taken from their website so I don't need to actually write something myself.
description.x-intellij-html-description:
Required. A description of the client. This is usually taken from their website so I don't need to actually write something myself.


Usage: Full page under the page title.

code.description: The client code. Usually used in billing, and typically 2-3 characters long.

color.description: The client's main color. Usually used in image backgrounds in case study posts.

category.description: The main category/section the item is in. Upon updating my sites to be separated between different audiences, this property will more closely resemble the current subcategory property. Options: webdev, photo
category.x-intellij-html-description:
The main category/section the item is in. Upon updating my sites to be separated between different audiences, this property will more closely resemble the current subcategory property.


Options: webdev, photo

img-base.description: Images for this project will be prepended with the value of this property.

last-update.description: When the page was last updated.

time.description: The time the client was active.

stack.description: The tech stack used. Eventually, I'd like to convert this to being an array so autocomplete is easier.

responsibilities.description: Responsibilities I had during the project.

team.description: Parameters are 'name', 'role', and 'url'.Repeat as many times as necessary, but ensure new entries have the dash in front of them and are indented as siblings of other items, not children.Repeated entries appear as a comma separated list.
team.x-intellij-html-description:
• Parameters are 'name', 'role', and 'url'.
  • Repeat as many times as necessary, but ensure new entries have the dash in front of them and are indented as siblings of other items, not children.
  • Repeated entries appear as a comma separated list.
Example renders:
Single:
NAME (ROLE)

Multiple
NAME (ROLE), NAME2 (ROLE2)

location.description: The location the project took place. Usually used for photography.

bgpos.description: Custom CSS for the background-position of the banner image. Default value is defined in /_layouts/flexfolio.html.
bgpos.x-intellij-html-description:
• Custom CSS for the background-position of the banner image.
  • Default value is defined in /_layouts/flexfolio.html.

Default value:
background-position: 50%;

subcategory.description: Single string shared by other items. Options: Photography, Lab, Commercial, Project

casestudy.description: This will determine if a unique page for this client is linked to or not. If false (default), then a link will not be generated to the separate page.

technical-class.description: This will be used as a CSS class in Technical blocks and can be used to style these sections differently.
